definitions.definition: a person who takes part in an undertaking with another or others, especially in a business or company with shared risks and profits.
examples: colleague, associate, coworker, fellow worker, collaborator, comrade, teammate; compeer business partners

definitions.definition: either of two people dancing together or playing a game or sport on the same side.
either member of a married couple or of an established unmarried couple.
a person with whom one has sex; a lover.
examples: spouse, husband, wife, consort, life partner; Morelover, girlfriend, boyfriend, fiancé, fiancée, significant other, live-in lover, common-law husband/wife, man, woman, mate; informalhubby, missus, old man, old lady/woman, better half, intended, other half, (main) squeeze "your relationship with your partner"Morelover, girlfriend, boyfriend, fiancé, fiancée, significant other, live-in lover, common-law husband/wife, man, woman, mate; hubby, missus, old man, old lady/woman, better half, intended, other half, (main) squeeze your relationship with your partner

definitions.definition: a friendly form of address by one man to another.
a timber framework secured to and strengthening the deck of a wooden ship around a hole for a mast.

examples: young farmers who partnered Isabel to the village dance
I never expected to partner with a man like you
